thread.title: The Weeknd, Maroon 5, Demi Lovato and more to raise breast cancer awareness at the annual 'We Can Survive' benefit
thread.title_full: The Weeknd, Maroon 5, Demi Lovato and more to raise breast cancer awareness at the annual 'We Can Survive' benefit

author: KELLI SKYE FADROSKI
title: The Weeknd, Maroon 5, Demi Lovato and more to raise breast cancer awareness at the annual 'We Can Survive' benefit
text: The Weeknd, Maroon 5, Demi Lovato and more to raise breast cancer awareness at the annual 'We Can Survive' benefit Oct. 16, 2015 Updated 7:32 a.m. 1 of 7 Canadian singer-songwriter The Weeknd, known for hits like “The Hills,”“Can't Feel My Face” and “Kiss Land,” will perform at the third annual We Can Survive benefit concert hosted by CBS Radio's 97.1 AMP FM at the Hollywood Bowl on Oct. 24. DAVID BRENDAN HALL, CONTRIBUTING PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 7 5 Seconds of Summer (Luke Hemmings pictured) will perform at the third annual We Can Survive benefit concert hosted by CBS Radio's 97.1 AMP FM at the Hollywood Bowl on Oct. 24. DREW A. KELLEY, CONTRIBUTING PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 7 Electronic artist Calvin Harris will perform at the third annual We Can Survive benefit concert hosted by CBS Radio's 97.1 AMP FM at the Hollywood Bowl on Oct. 24. ROBB D. COHEN, ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 7 Actress and singer-songwriter Demi Lovato, who released her fifth album, “Confident,” on Friday, will perform will perform at the third annual We Can Survive benefit concert hosted by CBS Radio's 97.1 AMP FM at the Hollywood Bowl on Oct. 24. POWERS IMAGERY 1 of 7 Rock band Maroon 5 (vocalist Adam Levine pictured) will perform at the third annual We Can Survive benefit concert hosted by CBS Radio's 97.1 AMP FM at the Hollywood Bowl on Oct. 24. KELLY A. SWIFT, CONTRIBUTING PHOTOGRAPHER 1 of 7 Pop star Nick Jonas will perform at the third annual We Can Survive benefit concert hosted by CBS Radio's 97.1 AMP FM at the Hollywood Bowl on Oct. 24. CHARLES SYKES, ASSOCIATED PRESS 1 of 7 English singer-songwriter Sam Smith will perform at the third annual We Can Survive benefit concert hosted by CBS Radio's 97.1 AMP FM at the Hollywood Bowl on Oct. 24. ROBB D. COHEN, ASSOCIATED PRESS View slideshow Canadian singer-songwriter The Weeknd, known for hits like “The Hills,”“Can't Feel My Face” and “Kiss Land,” will perform at the third annual We Can Survive benefit concert hosted by CBS Radio's 97.1 AMP FM at the Hollywood Bowl on Oct. 24. DAVID BRENDAN HALL, CONTRIBUTING PHOTOGRAPHER
